H0.text: What is prussic acid, found in bitter almonds and laurel leaves, also known as. Hydrogen Cyanide

H1.text: What is prussic acid, found in bitter almonds and laurel leaves, also known as. Cyanide

H2.text: What is prussic acid, found in bitter almonds and laurel leaves, also known as. Amygdalin

H3.text: What is prussic acid, found in bitter almonds and laurel leaves, also known as. 74908

A4.text: Hydrogen cyanide (also called prussic acid) is a chemical compound with the formula HCN.

A5.text: Many of these pits contain small amounts of cyanohydrins such as mandelonitrile and amygdalin, which slowly release hydrogen cyanide.
